clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Treatment With Rich Platelet Fibrin (PRF) VS Gold Standard in Patients Undergoing Knee Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Treatment With Rich Platelet Fibrin (PRF) VS Gold Standard in the Healing Process of Surgical Wounds in Patients Undergoing Knee Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controlled single blind trial for the evaluation of the treatment of the surgical wound healing process with Platelet-Rich-Fibrin compared to the gold standard (without Platelet-Rich-Fibrin) in patients undergoing knee replacement.

primary_outcome.measure: clinical improvement of the healing process
primary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement of the healing process, assessed by application of the Hollander Wound Evaluation Scales at 2 weeks of follow up

secondary_outcome.description: Dermatology life quality index improvement at 3 days, 15 days and 1 month

arm_group.description: treatment of the surgical wound healing process with Platelet-rich-fibrin in patients undergoing total knee replacement surgery
Gold standard treatment of the surgical wound healing process without Platelet-rich-fibrin in patients undergoing total knee replacement surgery
